page.title: 17THE RESERVOIR
page.content: The reservoir is near Brodsworth Colliery, and supplies water to Woodlands and Adwick. Along time ago water from the pit was mixed with water taken from artesian wells deep below the ground.The pit water was very hard with deposits of calcium carbonate.This water was softened in the water tower.The lime that was left over was pumped into lime pits nearby and left to settle.The lime was skimmed off and sold to farmers to spread on their pastures to improve the quality of the grass.No water is used from the pit now.All the water is purified with chlorine before it is pumped into the domestic water supply.
